page.title: 01Fauldhouse & Longridge Area
page.content: {Fauldhouse & Longridge }are two small villages in the west of the {Lothian Region of Scotland.}The twelve kilometre area around it meets the border of{Strathclyde Region. The{climate}is moderate, like the rest of Britain. Rainfall is fairly high due to its {central position between the North Sea & the Atlantic Ocean. The block is{750_800ft.}above sea level. There is no major industry in the twelve square kilometres. Most of the area is{forestry}and the rest {fenced grazing land. The {population} of Fauldhouse is approximately 6,000.Of Longridge it is approximately 1,000. The area is well serviced with {railway access }to both Edinburgh & Glasgow.Road access,to the{M8 motorway and to the main routes north & south, is also very good.
